intro: Indosasa levigata, commonly known as the smoothleaf indosasa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
